review_title: Low pay, but excellent health benefits coverage
job_title: in San Francisco, CA
pros:
Standard Kaiser plan. However the thing making it great is two-fold. 

1. No employee deduction for Kaiser health plan coverage, employer paid 100% of contributions towards health insurance. 

2. Company covered health insurance had no limit on spouse or number of children/dependents on coverage, employer still paid full coverage. 

Also company had very generous PTO policy after probation period and it got better the longer you stayed with them. Profit sharing and employer contributions to 401k were also good.
cons: While benefits were excellent, the low pay in a city like San Crancisco is not enough to retain a lot of people long term, especially if they are seeking advancement and professional development within the organization.

job_title: Anonymous Employee in San Francisco, CA
pros: Great co worker , stable , good health plan, a lot of sick leave and vacations for old folks
cons: Create a lot of administrative positions and mostly hired their relatives and friends son and daughter. One of them is best friend since college and the other is his old boss which is fired by his previous employer.  They will fired old folks and hired their friends and relatives.  They even fired the whole Accounting department and hiring new people which make me suspect they don't want people to know what they are doing.
